result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keosha I Nelson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keosha I Nelson appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Pre-trial conference held. Defendant needs to complete an assessment with the public defenders office to determine if the defendant is eligible. Case adjourned to Branch 1.
Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 10-05-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Walmart Supercenter.

Defendant Keosha I Nelson in court.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 1.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Keosha I Nelson
Current: 5043 N 63rd St, Milwaukee, WI 53282   (Effective: 03-02-2022)
Prior: 3925 North 21st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Keosha I Nelson not in court.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/18/22 @ 2p
